meanings.definition: To have floated outwards or away from something.
meanings.sent1: The leaf outfloated from the pond.
meanings.sent2: The balloon outfloated above the trees.
meanings.sent3: The paper boat outfloated all the other boats in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams outfloated into the night sky like colorful balloons.
meanings.sent5: The feather outfloated gently on the breeze, dancing in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The cork outfloated all the other objects in the water.
meanings.sent2: The foam outfloated effortlessly on the surface of the drink.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck outfloated the plastic boat in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism outfloated any doubts that tried to weigh her down.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's suit outfloated in the zero gravity of space, weightless and free.
